instructions.stepText: Cut off a piece of pizza dough and roll out over a floured surface until it's about 8 inches (20 cm) long. Try to get the dough as thin as possible.
Cover lightly in pizza sauce.

Place pepperoni at one end, so that the pepperoni aligns with the bottom of the dough. Place the second pepperoni piece so that it overlaps with the first piece, and is placed sightly higher than the bottom line of the dough. Continue layering pepperoni so that each one overlaps a bit less than the previous piece, and follows an upward angle.
Sprinkle the bottom half with low moisture mozzarella cheese, and beginning from the end with the most pepperoni, roll the dough into a lose coil.
Place in a muffin tin, with the pepperoni facing up.
If opting for the vegetarian version, peel long strips of skin off a tomato. (Video shows center ring being cut but you can peel strips from top to bottom to use more of the tomato)
Bake at 400°F (204°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until pepperoni edges are crispy and the dough is fully cooked through.
Remove from the oven and let cool. Lay over a bed of basil leaves (for taste and presentation).
Enjoy!

dialog.system: "On your marks, get set, cook! Step 1: Cut off a piece of pizza dough and roll out over a floured surface until it's about 8 inches (20 cm) long. Try to get the dough as thin as possible. "
"Step 2: Cover lightly in pizza sauce. "
"Going back to the previous step, Step 1: Cut off a piece of pizza dough and roll out over a floured surface until it's about 8 inches (20 cm) long. Try to get the dough as thin as possible. "

instructions.stepText: In a pestle and mortar, add the Garlic, Sea Salt and work it until both ingredients have become a paste.
Add the Pine Nuts and continue to work the paste until all the nuts have been crushed.
Start to add the Fresh Basil Leaf little by little working in a round slow motion to break the leaves and release the oil.
Once you have a few leaves done, start to add the oil and cheese little by little interchanging between basil leaves, Extra-Virgin Olive Oil, and Grated Parmesan Cheese.
Repeat the process until you've used all the leaves, taste for seasoning and adjust accordingly. This recipe does not have black pepper.

Once done, add Crushed Red Pepper Flakes. This is just to give a slight heat without overpowering the flavor and aroma of the basil. Add the sauce in a glass container with lid and place it in the fridge.
Well done! Want to save this recipe to your SideChef cookbook or meal plan? Try “Alexa, send to phone”.

dialog.system: "Are you ready to start cooking? Step 1: In a pestle and mortar, add the Garlic, Sea Salt and work it until both ingredients have become a paste. "
"Step 2: Add the Pine Nuts and continue to work the paste until all the nuts have been crushed. "
"Are you still with me? Step 3: Start to add the Fresh Basil Leaf little by little working in a round slow motion to break the leaves and release the oil. "
"Going back, Step 2: Add the Pine Nuts and continue to work the paste until all the nuts have been crushed. "
"Step 3: Start to add the Fresh Basil Leaf little by little working in a round slow motion to break the leaves and release the oil. "

instructions.stepText: Soak eight 12-inch wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes. Prepare a grill for medium heat. Cut a 12-inch-square piece of aluminum foil.
Stir together the oil, Italian seasoning and 1 teaspoon salt in a large bowl.

Dust a work surface with flour. Roll the dough into a rectangle about 11 by 6 by 1/4 inches. Using a pizza wheel or a knife, cut the dough into 1-inch strips, then into 1-inch squares. Add the dough squares, tomatoes and sausage to the seasoned oil, and toss gently to coat.

Working quickly to keep the dough from getting warm, thread the skewers, alternating sausage pieces (skewer them through the casings), tomatoes and dough squares (skewer them through opposite sides of each square, keeping them as flat as possible so they cook through). Leave 1/2 inch of the skewer at both ends empty. Each skewer should have 4 pieces each of sausage and dough and about 3 tomatoes.

Grill the skewers, covered, until the tomatoes have dark grill lines and the dough squares have started to puff, 2 to 3 minutes. Put the prepared foil square on the grill, and transfer the skewers onto the foil cooked-side up, so that they are almost touching. Top with the mozzarella, and grill, covered, until the tomatoes are soft, the dough squares have doubled in size and the mozzarella has melted, 3 minutes more.
Divide the skewers among 4 plates. Tear the basil leaves over the tops. Serve with the marinara sauce, for dipping, and pass the Parmesan and red pepper flakes.

"Step 5: Grill the skewers, covered, until the tomatoes have dark grill lines and the dough squares have started to puff, 2 to 3 minutes. Put the prepared foil square on the grill, and transfer the skewers onto the foil cooked-side up, so that they are almost touching. Top with the mozzarella, and grill, covered, until the tomatoes are soft, the dough squares have doubled in size and the mozzarella has melted, 3 minutes more. "

"You are in the home stretch! Step 6: Divide the skewers among 4 plates. Tear the basil leaves over the tops. Serve with the marinara sauce, for dipping, and pass the Parmesan and red pepper flakes. "

instructions.stepText: Put the oven on 250°C
Mix all the dry ingredients together
Add water and oil and work everything together to a smooth dough
Roll out the dough on a plate, thick or thin. REMEMBER! The thicker the dough you have, add about two minutes to the cooking-time
Put the pizza in the oven for 5-6 minutes
Take out the pizza and add the pizza-sauce, cheese, and your topping (on the pictures I used ham and red onion)
Put the pizza back in the oven and have it in the oven until the cheese has melt
Take it out and ENJOY!

dialog.system: "All set? Here's Step 1: Put the oven on 250\u00b0C "

instructions.stepText: Soak eight 12-inch wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes. Prepare a grill for medium heat. Cut a 12-inch-square piece of aluminum foil.
Stir together the oil, Italian seasoning and 1 teaspoon salt in a large bowl.

Dust a work surface with flour. Roll the dough into a rectangle about 11 by 6 by 1/4 inches. Using a pizza wheel or a knife, cut the dough into 1-inch strips, then into 1-inch squares. Add the dough squares, tomatoes and sausage to the seasoned oil, and toss gently to coat.

Working quickly to keep the dough from getting warm, thread the skewers, alternating sausage pieces (skewer them through the casings), tomatoes and dough squares (skewer them through opposite sides of each square, keeping them as flat as possible so they cook through). Leave 1/2 inch of the skewer at both ends empty. Each skewer should have 4 pieces each of sausage and dough and about 3 tomatoes.

Grill the skewers, covered, until the tomatoes have dark grill lines and the dough squares have started to puff, 2 to 3 minutes. Put the prepared foil square on the grill, and transfer the skewers onto the foil cooked-side up, so that they are almost touching. Top with the mozzarella, and grill, covered, until the tomatoes are soft, the dough squares have doubled in size and the mozzarella has melted, 3 minutes more.
Divide the skewers among 4 plates. Tear the basil leaves over the tops. Serve with the marinara sauce, for dipping, and pass the Parmesan and red pepper flakes.

dialog.user: Give me all the steps together.
dialog.system: "Alrighty! Here are the steps for this recipe: 1. Prepare your baking dish by greasing it with butter and sprinkling the Creamy Jalape\u00f1o Sauce and Shredded Cheddar Cheese over the bottom of the dish. 2. Cut your White Corn Tortillas into strips and place them in a single layer in the baking dish, covering the sauce and cheese. 3. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). 4. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the tortillas are golden brown and crispy. 5. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce and enjoy! "

instructions.stepText: Place a 12-inch cast-iron skillet in the oven and preheat to 500 degrees F.

Meanwhile, roll or stretch the dough into a 14-inch circle. Carefully remove the skillet from the oven. Drizzle two thirds of the olive oil into the skillet, then carefully transfer the dough to the skillet, pressing the dough up the edges. Spread the sauce over the dough, making sure to get all the way to the edges. Shingle the pepperoni over the sauce and top with the mozzarella pearls. Brush the exposed dough with the remaining olive oil. Bake on the bottom rack until golden brown, 12 to 14 minutes.
Transfer to a cutting board, top with torn basil, cut into slices and serve.
